get.description: Returns active projects visible to the authenticated user. Pagination data is exposed via standard Link headers.

post.description: Create a new project with an optional description.

get.description: Fetch the full representation of a single project by its identifier.

put.description: Update a project name, description, admissions policy, or schedule dates. Basecamp requires the name to be present in every update request.

delete.description: Move a project to the trash. The project will be permanently deleted after 30 days unless restored via the UI.

get.description: Returns the people visible to the authenticated user across the entire Basecamp account. Pagination data is provided through Link headers when the dataset exceeds a single page.
Returns the active people on a specific project.

put.description: Grant, revoke, or create people directly on a project. At least one of grant, revoke, or create must be present in the request body.

get.description: Returns the people who can be pinged by the authenticated user. The endpoint is not paginated.
Fetch the profile for a person by identifier.
Fetch the profile for the authenticated user.
Returns a paginated list of recordings filtered by type and optional bucket or status filters. Use this endpoint to enumerate cross-project activity for a specific recording type.

put.description: Mark a recording as trashed. Trashed recordings can be restored via the UI.
Mark a recording as archived. Archived recordings remain available but hidden.
Mark a recording as active to reverse a previous archive action.

get.description: Returns the event history for a specific recording. Pagination data is available via Link headers.

post.description: Create an account-wide lineup marker that appears on the Lineup timeline.

put.description: Update the name or date of an existing lineup marker.

delete.description: Permanently delete a lineup marker immediately.

get.description: Return the to-do set container for a project. Use this to discover to-do lists and their groups.
List active to-do lists within a to-do set. Pagination metadata is exposed via Link headers.

post.description: Create a new to-do list inside a to-do set. Descriptions accept rich text HTML.

get.description: Fetch a to-do list or group. When the list represents a group, the payload includes a group_position_url instead of groups_url.

put.description: Update the name or description of an existing to-do list. Basecamp requires the name to be present on every update.
Move a to-do list or group to the trash. Trashed items can be restored from the Basecamp UI.

get.description: List the to-do list groups contained within a to-do list. Use the status filter to browse archived or trashed groups.

post.description: Create a nested group inside a to-do list. Groups share the same representation as to-do lists.

put.description: Change the position of a to-do list group within its parent list.

get.description: List pending or completed to-dos within a to-do list. Use the status and completed filters to target archived or finished items.

post.description: Create a to-do inside a to-do list. Rich text HTML is accepted in the description.

get.description: Fetch a single to-do item by its identifier.

put.description: Update the content, description, assignees, or scheduling fields of an existing to-do. The content field must always be provided.

post.description: Mark a to-do as completed.

delete.description: Remove the completion mark from a to-do.

put.description: Change the position of a to-do within its list.
Move a to-do to the trash queue.

get.description: Return a message board container for a project.
Return message boards available for a project.
get.summary: List message boards for a project

get.description: Return all message types (categories) available in a project.

post.description: Create a new message type in a project.

get.description: Return a specific message type by its ID.

put.description: Update an existing message type.

delete.description: Delete a message type from a project.

get.description: Returns the messages currently visible on a message board. Pagination data is available via the Link and X-Total-Count headers.

post.description: Publish a message to a specific message board. Setting status to "active" makes the message visible immediately.

get.description: Fetch the full representation of a single message.

put.description: Update the subject, content, or category of an existing message.

post.description: Pin a message recording. The same endpoint is used to pin other recording types.

delete.description: Remove a pinned message. Returns no content on success.

put.description: Move a message recording to the trash. Trashed items can be restored via the UI.

get.description: Return paginated comments for a recording.

post.description: Create a new comment on a recording.

get.description: Return a specific comment by its ID.

put.description: Update an existing comment.
Move a comment to the trash.

get.description: Fetch the full representation of a card table, including column summaries and subscribers.
Fetch a single column belonging to a card table.

put.description: Update the title or description of a column. At least one field must be provided per request.

post.description: Create a new column within a card table. Descriptions accept rich text HTML strings.
Reorder a column within a card table. Positions are evaluated within the table, ignoring system columns like Triage and Done.
Subscribe the current user to notifications for a column.

delete.description: Unsubscribe the current user from column notifications.
delete.summary: Stop watching a card table column

post.description: Enable the on-hold section for a card table column.
post.summary: Enable on hold for a column

delete.description: Remove the on-hold section from a card table column.
delete.summary: Disable on hold for a column

put.description: Set the color for a card table column.

get.description: Return the paginated list of cards belonging to a column. Pagination metadata is provided via Link headers.

post.description: Create a card inside a column. Content accepts rich text HTML; notify toggles assignee notifications.

get.description: Fetch the full representation of a card, including its steps.

put.description: Update the title, content, due date, or assignees of an existing card. At least one field must be provided.

post.description: Move a card to a different column and/or position. Positions are zero-indexed within the destination column.
Create a checklist step within a card. Assignees should be provided as a comma-separated list of person IDs.

put.description: Update the title, due date, or assignees of a step. At least one field must be supplied.
Toggle a step between completed and uncompleted states.

post.description: Move a step to a new zero-indexed position within a card.

get.description: Returns the Campfires visible to the authenticated user. Results are paginated via Link headers.
Fetch a single Campfire transcript for a project.
Return paginated chat lines for a Campfire transcript.

post.description: Post a new line of chat to a Campfire transcript.

get.description: Fetch a single Campfire line by identifier.
Return the inbox container for a project. Use the forwards endpoint to list mail forwards associated with the inbox.
Returns the email forwards that live under a project inbox. Results are paginated via Link headers.
Fetch a single email forward recording.

put.description: Move a forward to the trash. Trashed forwards can be restored from the Basecamp UI if needed.

get.description: Returns replies that were posted on a forwarded email.
Fetch a single reply posted to a forwarded email.
Returns the client approvals that have been posted in a project. Results are paginated.
Fetch a specific client approval recording.
Returns the client correspondences posted in a project.
Fetch a specific client correspondence recording.
Returns replies that clients posted to client correspondences or client approvals.
Fetch a single reply posted by a client.

put.description: Update whether a recording is visible to clients. Only recordings that control their own visibility can be toggled.

get.description: Returns the schedule for a project. All schedule entries under a project are children of this resource.

put.description: Update whether the schedule should include due dates from to-dos, cards, and steps.

get.description: Returns a paginated list of schedule entries in a schedule. Use status filter to get archived or trashed entries.

post.description: Creates a new schedule entry in a schedule. Required fields: summary, starts_at, and ends_at.

get.description: Returns a schedule entry. For recurring entries, this redirects to the first occurrence.

put.description: Updates an existing schedule entry. Any create parameters can be changed.

get.description: Returns a specific occurrence of a recurring schedule entry (e.g., 20190218 for February 18, 2019).
get.summary: Get a specific occurrence of a recurring schedule entry

put.description: Moves a schedule entry to the trash. Trashed items can be restored via the UI.

get.description: Returns the questionnaire for a project. All automatic check-in questions are children of this resource.
Returns a paginated list of questions in a questionnaire (automatic check-ins).
Returns a single automatic check-in question with its schedule and metadata.
Returns a paginated list of active documents in a vault. Pagination data is available via the Link and X-Total-Count headers.

post.description: Publish a document in a vault. Setting status to "active" makes the document visible immediately.

get.description: Fetch the full representation of a single document.

put.description: Update the title or content of an existing document.
Move a document recording to the trash. Trashed items can be restored via the UI.

get.description: Returns a paginated list of vaults nested under a parent vault. Pagination data is available via the Link and X-Total-Count headers.

post.description: Create a new vault nested under a parent vault.

get.description: Fetch the full representation of a single vault.

put.description: Update the title of an existing vault.
Move a vault recording to the trash. Trashed items can be restored via the UI.

get.description: Returns a paginated list of active uploads in a vault. Pagination data is available via the Link and X-Total-Count headers.

post.description: Create an upload in a vault using a previously obtained attachable_sgid from the attachments endpoint.

get.description: Fetch the full representation of a single upload.

put.description: Update the description or base name of an existing upload.
Move an upload recording to the trash. Trashed items can be restored via the UI.

post.description: Upload a file to get an attachable_sgid that can be used in subsequent requests to create uploads or documents. The request body should be the raw binary file data. Note: Content-Type and Content-Length headers must be set by the caller.
